conclusion: Use properties of ideal gas and relationships given in the figure.
Identify states and given data for states A, B, and C.
Use ideal gas law PV = nRT to relate the states.
Line segment AB is parallel to the V axis, indicating constant pressure.
Since line segment AB is parallel to the V axis, P_A = P_B.
Since P_A = P_0 and P_B = P_0, P_B = P_0.
Use relationship V/T = constant for states A and B to find T_B.
Calculate T_B using V_A/T_A = V_B/T_B, resulting in T_B = 2T_0.
Pressure of gas in state B is P_B = P_0 and temperature is T_B = 2T_0.
